evidence.text:
Person B: Do you want to see your mother’s room?
Person A: Yes, please.
Person A: Did she tell you about me?
Person B: So, she told you about my father?
Person B: She did.
Person A: Don’t you think she should have helped him when he came back from the war?
Person A: My mother never told me anything about that.
Person A: She could have done it later.
Person B: By then you were so estranged that it wasn't possible anymore. Your mother was a teenager and she had a life to live… And your father went to San Diego and he made no effort to know you.
Person A: So, Ingrid, do you think I was totally mistaken about Martha?
Person A: No, she wasn’t… Can I stay here tonight?
Person B: Of course! This is your mother’s house.
